item.title: Why I like "git rebase"
item.description: I guess when most of people getting started using Git, they always use git merge to integrate changes from another branch. But after I understood rebase, I can't stop loving it.

item.title: Create json-server with multiple files
item.description: With json-server, Frontend engineers can develop without relying on Backend. But it's not handy to maintain it due to its single .json file entry. Why not splitting each API into separate files.

item.title: Dive into VuePress with Plugin APIs
item.description: The most important change in VuePress 1.x is Pluggable. It flashed on my mind that if I figure out the execution sequence of all the plugin APIs and what is really executed, maybe it's a special approach to understand the ins and outs of how VuePress works.

item.title: Intro to VuePress blog theme and plugin
item.description: Build a blog with VuePress. With static site generator, it's pretty easy to build your own blog. If you're familiar with Vue, VuePress could be a good choice. Even though you've never used vue before, you can still use the out-of-box theme.

item.title: Caveats about building npm packages
item.description: The dump things I've done when I was building npm packages
